item.description:
Note: This is not a MeetUp Event, just a reminder that registration for the fall term at Harvard Extension School begins on August 18th.
S.

Harvard Extension School

August 19th: HES Information Session

From the HES Website: There are numerous paths to personal enrichment and professional development at Harvard Extension School. Their open-enrollment courses and academic programs offer non-traditional students a challenging academic experience at tuition rates that rank among the lowest in Boston.

Courses and Programs
Explore a subject that interests you. Build skills to advance your career. Enroll in a degree or certificate program. With 620 courses, the Extension School offers a range of possibility. Vital subject areas such as environmental management, information technology, and biotechnology. Professional graduate certificate and degree programs. Career and study skills workshops.

Faculty
Whether you study biology or music, you learn from experts; Harvard professors offering their Harvard College courses at the Extension School; leading faculty from local universities; community and business leaders.

Students and Alumni
The population of nearly 13,000 students is diverse. All students share a common goal to challenge themselves and satisfy their intellectual curiosity. Alumni have gone on to attend prestigious graduate programs and become leaders in fields such as business, medicine, education, and law.

- Students range in age from early teens to 80s; average age is 33.
- They come from 118 countries and 46 US states.
- Seventy-five percent have bachelor's degrees; 25 percent have graduate degrees.
item.name: Continuing Education at Harvard
